ResourceHeader.ResourceName: OMTI All-Sky Imager Quick-Look Data (OH emission, 720.0-910.0nm, 1s) at Kapuskasing
ResourceHeader.Description: Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTI) All-Sky Imager Quick-Look Data of OH emission taken with the longer-than-720.0 nm or 720.0-910.0 nm filter at Kapuskasing, Canada
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers All-Sky Imager Data. PI: Kazuo Shiokawa and Yuichi Otsuka, Institute for Space-Earth Environmental Research, Nagoya University, Furo-cho, Chikusa-ku, Nagoya, Aichi 464-8601, Japan. Rules of the Road for OMTI ASI Data Use: 1. Please contact the Principal Investigator (PI), K. Shiokawa (shiokawa at isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) or Y. Otsuka, ISEE, Nagoya University before using the data at any publications and/or presentations. 2. Please cite Shiokawa et al. (1999) and/or Shiokawa et al. (2009) in the publication. The detailed citation is: * Shiokawa et al., Earth Planets Space, 51, p.887-896, 1999. * Shiokawa et al., Earth Planets Space, 61, p.479-491, 2009. For more information, see http://stdb2.isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp/omti/

AccessURL.Name: Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTIs)
AccessURL.Description: Website of the Optical Mesosphere Thermosphere Imagers (OMTIs), containing quick-look plots of all the OMTIs instruments, description of the stations and instruments, and 1-hour status of sky condition.

DisplayData.Keyword: EARTH SCIENCE Sun-earth Interactions Ionosphere/Magnetosphere Dynamics Ion Chemistry/Ionization

Parameter.Name: epoch for image
Parameter.Description: Time for which image data are taken, in double-decision Unix time

Parameter.Name: epoch for image in the "yyyy mm dd hh mm ss" format
Parameter.Description: Time for which image data are taken, in an array containing year, month, day, hour, minute, and second as integers

Parameter.Name: Exposure time
Parameter.Description: Exposure time in second for which the CCD count is integrated to take each image.

Parameter.Name: raw image data taken with the longer-than-720.0 nm or 720.0-910.0 nm filter
Parameter.Description: Raw image data of OH emission taken with the longer-than-720.0 nm or 720.0-910.0 nm filter as 512x512 pixel or 256x256 pixel. The unit is count/sample.
